page.title: 11RECREATION FISHING:MK WESTON
page.content: Hidden by over hanging trees amongst farmland in the South Eastern corner of Market Weston there lies a round and very deep pool. It is a favourite haunt of village boys who like to try their skill at fishing with rod and line: one can catch not only the common Stickle- backs but also Roach, Rudd, Tench & Pike.The pond's name 'The Pikel'was likely derived from the latter in years past. It was once used by horse-drawn carts to collect the water for daily use as depicted on an old sign, which has now fallen down. Adults however rarely visit this village pond now. Moorhens nest in a tree-stump which has fallen across it reeds grow in pro- fusion around its edge and birds nest in the trees above. There is tranquility, disturbed by none but the young fishermen.
